summary: This is an email chain from November 12, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff discussing a media inquiry about the FBI sharing findings with Jeffrey Epstein's victims. The emails clarify that an upcoming meeting with victims will address the Office of Professional Responsibility's investigation into the Southern District of Florida's handling of the non-prosecution agreement (NPA) and victim rights, not the criminal investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Media Inquiry about FBI Victim Meeting
events.description: The New York Post and Mirror Online inquire about reports that the FBI will be sharing findings with Jeffrey Epstein's victims, including information about Prince Andrew.

events.title: Planned OPR Meeting with Epstein Victims
events.description: The FBI and the Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) plan to meet with victims to discuss OPR's findings regarding the Southern District of Florida's dealings with victims, focusing on the Crime Victims' Rights Act and the negotiation of the non-prosecution agreement (NPA). The meeting will not discuss the criminal investigation.

keyFacts: In November 2020, media outlets reported the FBI would share findings with Epstein's victims, including information about Prince Andrew.

U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) staff internally clarified that an upcoming victim meeting would focus on the Office of Professional Responsibility's (OPR) review of the Southern District of Florida's conduct, not the criminal case.
The planned meeting with victims was to address the Crime Victims' Rights Act and the negotiation of the non-prosecution agreement (NPA) in the Epstein case.
The email chain shows the USANYS office deferring to the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) regarding the media inquiry, indicating the matter was outside their purview.
